subject: Re: [junit] setting up resources once for the entire test cycle?

messageBody:
Yagiz Erkan wrote:

> > so it should load the appContext just once for that testcase, but
> > appContext is always null when entering the setUp() method so its
> > loading the appContext for every test of the testcase, loading the
> > appContext takes alot of time so I only want this to happen once, what
> > do you guys do in this situation?
>
> Another option, other than the extensions:
>
> 1) Load the resource using a Singleton,
> 2) Create a generic TestCase getting the resource from that Singleton in the
> setUp() method
> 3) Subclass the generic TestCase when you need a new TestCase.
>
> I think it should work this way too...

This works, but introducing a BaseTestCase just to store global data is
like using a sledgehammer to kill a fly.

Since ResourceManager from JUnit-addons is just a big Singleton anyway,
you might as well just use their implementation rather than build your own.
